context: After all these years, 53 to be exact, there is but one flag on the moon; the Stars and Stripes, and it was raised there with the inscription:  "Here men from the planet Earth first set foot upon the moon, July 1969 A.D. We came in peace for all mankind." Get it, China?

I wonder if the new telescope could zoom in on the landing sites and give US a high resolution photo of our flag and what‚Äôs left of the lunar landing module??

The six successful landings on the Moon each left a US flag. Only the Apollo 11, the first flag set on the moon, has been returned to the Earth. The other five remain. Yes, in the Moon's harsh environment, in constant exposure to the Sun, they are deteriorating, but they are still there.
It's hard to believe but there will soon come a time when no living human will have set foot on the moon.
